title: A man walks 1 km to East and then he turns to South and walks 5 km. Again he turns to East and walks 2 km. After this he turns to North and walks 9 km. Now, how far is he from his starting point? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1 Walksing 1 km to East 2 Walking 5 km to South 3 Again walking 2 km to East 4 Lastly walking 9 km to North would mean He is 1+2=3 km East from starting point,and nullifies 5 km walking to South and is positioned 4 km in the direction of North. 5 He is 3 km in the direction of East and 4 km from there in the direction of North that is to say he is 3+4=7 km from his starting point in the direction of North-west.

On paper when we draw.all steps of 4 stints ultimately the man reached from the starting point total 1km+2 km or 3 km towards East and 9km-5 km or 4 km towards North from W-E line . So, straight distance of this final point is Hypotenuse of right triangle with base as 3km and height 4km i.e √ ( 3^2 + 4^2) km or 5km towards North-East at angle with respect to W-E of arctan 4/3
